readability_reflection: I found interpolation to be more readable than concatenation because it allows variables to be embedded directly in the string making the output easier to read at a glance. For example, writing "Hello, {name}!" is much cleaner and less error-prone than "Hello, " + name + "!", especially when multiple variables are involved.
comprehension_debugging: Yes, string interpolation made it easier to quickly understand and debug code since the variables were embedded directly in the string, reducing visual clutter compared to chained concatenation operations
preference_rationale: I would choose string interpolation due to the improved readability, cleaner syntax, and reduced likelihood of syntax errors, especially when working with multiple variables.
learning_curve: My prior experience with both techniques helped, but I found interpolation examples easier to follow because they more closely resemble natural sentence structure, making the intent of the code clearer and easy to understand
suggestions_improvement: One improvement could be consistent support for interpolation across more languages and better tooling in editors to highlight variables within interpolated strings for quicker comprehension.
